terrapeer.vui.j3dui.visualize
Class DisplayOverlayGroup

java.lang.Object
  javax.media.j3d.SceneGraphObject
      javax.media.j3d.Node
          javax.media.j3d.Group
              terrapeer.vui.j3dui.control.actuators.GroupChain
                  terrapeer.vui.j3dui.control.actuators.groups.ActuatorGroup
                      terrapeer.vui.j3dui.visualize.DisplayOverlayGroup
All Implemented Interfaces:
EnableTarget, ViewChangeTarget
public class DisplayOverlayGroup
extends ActuatorGroup
implements ViewChangeTarget

This class is an actuator group that helps supports "display overlay" visualization behavior. It together with a DisplayOverlayRoot defines a 2D space parallel to the view display plane where objects are positioned in X-Y in units of pixels relative to this groups origin. Objects are placed in separate "overlay planes" that define their Z overlay order, with "0" as the base plane, +Z in front towards the eye, and -Z in back away from the eye.

Use this group's setRelativeOrigin() to position its origin in the display space relative to the display origin (center of display window); and, use its setAbsoluteOffset() to offset its children relative to this group's origin. The former setting allows this group to maintain its relative position in the display window in spite of resizing, and the latter specifies the point of reference in the child node space that will maintain this relative display position, such as for widgets in a dashboard.

This group attaches itself directly to a host display overlay root. To place an object in display overlay the object must be added as a child of a DisplayOverlayGroup, which in turn is a child of a DisplayOverlayRoot. Non-planar child objects may cause unpredictable results.

For this object to work properly all of its event inputs must be connected and they must have received initial events.

  • ViewChangeTarget: Internal state of the view observing this node. External state is ignored. Only works reliably for one view.

Having to use separate nodes for the overlay "root" and "group" is a kludge necessitated by a bug in Java 3D 1.1.2 where overlapping transparent objects, such as those using transparent textures, will only render correctly if 1) they are under an OrderedGroup in proper render order and 2) they are in correct Z position relative to the eye for correct overlap.

Method Detail

setRelativeOrigin

public javax.vecmath.Tuple2d setRelativeOrigin(javax.vecmath.Tuple2d origin)
Sets the X-Y position of this group's origin in normalized display overlay space (i.e. that of the display overlay root). The position is expressed as a fraction of the display size (not pixels) and is relative to the display space origin (center of display window).

Parameters:
origin - Position of origin as a fraction of each display dimension (i.e. 0.25 is 25% of the width or height of the display window).
Returns:
Reference to offset.

getRelativeOrigin

public javax.vecmath.Tuple2d getRelativeOrigin()
Gets the relative position of this group's origin relative to that of its host display space. The offset is expressed as a fraction of the display window size.

Returns:
Reference to the relative origin position.

getAbsoluteOrigin

public javax.vecmath.Tuple2d getAbsoluteOrigin(javax.vecmath.Tuple2d origin)

Parameters:
origin - Return copy of the absolute origin position.
Returns:
Reference to position.

setAbsoluteOffset

public javax.vecmath.Tuple2d setAbsoluteOffset(javax.vecmath.Tuple2d offset)
Sets the X-Y offset of this group's child nodes in normalized display overlay space (i.e. that of the display overlay root) relative to this group's origin. The offset is absolute and is expressed in display pixels.

Parameters:
offset - Offset of the child nodes.
Returns:
Reference to offset.

Parameters:

Adds the specified node to the specified Z plane.

Parameters:
node - Node added to the chain tail. Ignored if null.
zPlane - Z-plane that the child will be added to. If out of range uses the closest plane. Z_PLANE_MIN <= zPos <= Z_PLANE_MAX.
Returns:
Reference to child node.
